travelgui

Class VacationPackageCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • travelgui.VacationPackageCollection

  • public class VacationPackageCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a collection to store, filter, and explore VacationPackages within the trip search user interface. Up to 25 VacationPackages can be stored in a single collection.
    Author:
    bdorn

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VacationPackageCollection()
      Creates a new empty VacationPackageCollection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VacationPackageCollection

        public VacationPackageCollection()
        Creates a new empty VacationPackageCollection.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumTrips

        public int getNumTrips()
        Retrieves the number of trip packages that have been added to this collection for purchase.
        Returns:
        The total number of available packages.

      • getAllVacations

        public VacationPackage[] getAllVacations()
        Retrieves an array of all available packages from the collection. Valid packages are guaranteed to be stored contiguously in the left most array cells. Any empty cells will appear to the right of the last valid VacationPackage.

        Unless a sort has occurred, packages will appear in the order in which they were added.

        Returns:
        The list of available packages, or null if no packages exist.

      • addVacation

        public void addVacation(VacationPackage trip)
        Adds a single trip package to the collection at the next available position. If adding this trip would result in more than 25 total packages, it will not be added to the collection.
        Parameters:
        trip - The trip to add to the collection.

      • filterVacationsFor

        public VacationPackageCollection filterVacationsFor(int selection)
        Retrieves a filtered subcollection of trips corresponding to a specific subtype. Should no trips of a specified type be present in this VacationPackageCollection an empty collection containing zero packages will be returned.
        Parameters:
        selection - An integer signaling what type of packages to extract. 1 represents RoadTrips, 2 represents Cruises, and 3 represents All-Inclusive Resort packages.
        Returns:
        The filtered subcollection of packages, or an empty collection if no matching packages exist in this collection.

      • getFlightDetails

        public java.lang.String getFlightDetails(int index)
        Produces a summary of flight information inside a VacationPackage for detail display elsewhere. In addition to properly extracting flight details when the given index corresponds to a FlightOptionalPackage with one or more flight legs, this method will also dectect various error conditions. In erroneous situations, one of the following strings will be produced: 
        ERROR: Index is out of range!
ERROR: No flights are allowed for this type of trip!
ERROR: The selected trip has no flight information.
        Each of these errors corresponds to invalid range input, packages for which flights cannot be added in the first place, and packages which potentially could (but do not yet) have flight data.
        Parameters:
        index - The index position in the collection from which to extract flight information.
        Returns:
        The formatted flight details, with one Flight per line and each Flight displayed as detailed in Flight.toString.

      • getItemAt

        public VacationPackage getItemAt(int index)
        Provides 0-based indexed access to the VacationPackageCollection.
        Parameters:
        index - The index position whose VacationPackage should be returned.
        Returns:
        The selected VacationPackage when index is valid. The method will return null otherwise.

      • sortCollection

        public void sortCollection(boolean byPrice)
        Produces a stable sort of the contents of this VacationPackageCollection, with the sort order determined by an externally specified criteria. When byPrice is true, the method will sort all available packages in ascending order by total package price. When false, the method sorts packages in standard lexicographically ascending order by package name (see, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lexicographical_order).
        Parameters:
        byPrice - A flag which sets the sort criteria as described above.
